meanings.definition: To make three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: She was trebling her savings by depositing a portion of her paycheck each month.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to treble its production to meet the increasing demand.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved trebling the number of colorful scarves he pulled out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the new policy on the environment was like trebling the number of cars on the road overnight.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise seemed to treble the student's confidence in his abilities.

meanings.definition: Three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: The trebling amount of work left her feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: He was amazed by the trebling number of participants in the event.
meanings.sent3: The trebling crowd at the concert made it difficult to find a good spot.
meanings.sent4: The trebling cost of living in the city was a major concern for the residents.
meanings.sent5: The trebling size of the cake was perfect for the large family gathering.

meanings.sent1: The trebling of votes in favor of the new policy was a clear sign of its popularity.
meanings.sent2: She was surprised by the trebling of visitors to the museum after the new exhibit opened.
meanings.sent3: The trebling of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a deliciously rich dessert.
meanings.sent4: The trebling of stars in the night sky created a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The trebling of books on the shelf made it look more organized and full.
